SENT.plain: Familial cold autoinflammatory syndrome (FCAS) is a dominantly inherited syndrome caused by mutations of the CIAS1 gene
It is characterized by recurrent episodes involving fever, urticaria, articular symptoms and conjunctivitis
The episodes may be associated with exposure to cold
In some families, association with reactive AA amyloidosis has been described for the syndrome
We describe a Finnish family, in which at least 16 persons were affected with FCAS, and one person had been diagnosed with renal amyloidosis
